summary: The Supremes were an American girl group from Detroit, Michigan, who became famous in the 1960s. They started as the Primettes and later signed with Motown Records. The Supremes were very successful, with 12 number-one hits. Their songs were mostly written by the team Holland–Dozier–Holland. The original members were Florence Ballard, Mary Wilson, Diana Ross, and Betty McGlown. Over time, the group's lineup changed, and they eventually disbanded in 1977. The Supremes' success helped future African-American musicians find mainstream success.
title: The Supremes
